alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 4:26PM EDT until July 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Cumberland County in south central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Perry County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 426 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Big Spring State Park, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Carlisle, Plainfield, Schlusser, Newville, Carlisle Springs, Bloserville, Colonel Denning State Park, Walnut Bottom, Big Spring State Park, Doylesburg, New Germantown and Penn State Dickinson School Of Law. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 196 to 224. Interstate 81 from mile markers 32 to 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
